column2: He then identifies several" exceptional"  grounds in paragraph 12 of
his  petition,  inviting  this  Court  to  exercise  its  revisionary  jurisdiction  in

column1: consideration of them. These grounds include the failure of the High Court

column2: to note that there was no condition to  re-offend, no evidence of him posing

column1: a flight risk, he has right to bail and no previous convictions, the Court had

column2: incarceration,  is  violative  of  presumption  of  innocence  and  of  his  rights
under ICCPR Act No. 56 of 2007 and set up a wrong judicial precedent.
